Kassapa's contentment with different thi: Kassapa is content with any kind of robe
Kassapa is content with any kind of almsfood
Kassapa is content with any kind of lodging
Kassapa is content with any kind of medicines and supplies for the sick
The way to train oneself [sn16.1:6.5]: Be content with any kind of robe, and praise such contentment
Don’t try to get hold of a robe in an improper way
Don’t get upset if you don’t get a robe
If you do get a robe, use it untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawback, and understanding the escape
Be content with any kind of almsfood
Be content with any kind of lodging
Be content with any kind of medicines and supplies for the sick
The exhortation to practice accordingly: The example of Kassapa or someone like him
